components.description:
A tropical fish, as swims in the warm waters of a coral reef or is kept as a pet in an aquarium. Depicted as a brightly colored fish in full profile facing left, with slender fins. Often shown as a blue-and-yellow fish with stripes, as an angelfish.

May be used to represent a variety of fish (saltwater or freshwater), fishing, metaphorical senses of fish, and fish as food, as consumed in the form of üç£ Sushi. Not to be confused with üêü Fish or üê° Blowfish, though their applications may overlap. See also üé£ Fishing Pole.

Google and Facebook’s fish previously resembled a goldfish, while Samsung’s was black and white. Microsoft’s fish was previously orange with white stripes, and yellow and blue before that.
components.title: Tropical Fish

title: Tropical Fish

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.
